features.caption: Ilias Osmos next to the Chief Rabbi of Crete, Avraam Evlagon, inside Beth Shalom Synagogue of Hania. They are preparing for King's Konstantinos visit, and for a short ceremony on the occasion of Crete's unification with Greece (1913).
features.copyright: Hania Philological Association 'Chrysostomos'

features.caption: Announcement of the wedding of Moisis Osmos and Sarra Koen (1938).
features.copyright: To Vema tou Laou (01/25/1938)

features.caption: On March 18, 1944 the funeral of the honorary consul of Germany  in Hania, Richard Kruger, took place. On the left side of the coffin, in the center, one can see Ilias Osmos, then Rabbi of Hania. He attended the ceremony as a representative of the Jewish population of Hania, together with the rest of the local Authorities.
features.copyright: Manolis Manousakas' Archive

features.caption: The Athens Jewish Community confirms that Eliasan and Avraam Trevezas were arrested and sent to the concentration camps, and that their fate remained unknown ever since. Refkoula and Emilia survived in Athens.
